alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Coos and northeastern Grafton Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 104 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Littleton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Littleton, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Franconia, Stratford, Carroll, Gorham, Lisbon, Jefferson, Dalton, Easton, Whitefield, Sugar Hill, Randolph, Stark, Northumberland, Shelburne and Milan. This includes Interstate 93 between mile markers 110 and 131. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for northern New Hampshire.
